--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Johannes Link" <john.link@g...> wrote:
> Hi Dave, hi Nathan,

> From browsing the Jemmy examples and duplicating them, I got the
> impression that one has to implement the Scenario interface and then
> call Test.main(). From what you both write I take it this is not the
> case, right? One can just use the Jemmy classes standalone. This
> makes using Jemmy from within JUnit much easier than I thought it
> was.

It is very easy in fact.  I use this approach in my TDD book for the
GUI related stuff.  I'll post some example to the files section of
this group in a few minutes.

Dave
